Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not before); 20TH DYNASTY; 20TH DYNASTY (not after)
Material: SAND; FIBER (FROM PLANTS AND ANIMALS); PLASTER
Name: Head of a funerary statue
Description: The head of a statue of a man wearing a compound double-wig with a wide and smooth band around the upper half of the forehead and curls rendered by deep incisions. The statue originally stood with its back against a support or against the wall of a tomb.
